page.title: 13YARD GAMES
page.content: AT SCHOOL WE PLAY A FEW GAMES. ONE IS CALLED BRITISH BULLDOG.ONE PERSON OUT OF THE GROUP HAS TO STAND IN THE MIDDLE OF THE YARD AND THE GROUP ARE AT ONE END OF THE YARD . THE ONE IN THE MIDDLE CALLS OUT THE NAME OF SOMEONE IN THE GROUP AND HE OR SHE HAS TO RUN TO THE OTHER END OF THE YARD WITHOUT THE ONE WHO IS CATCHER GRABBING HOLD AND SAYING BRITISH BULLDOG ONE,TWO,THREE. IF HE OR SHE IS CAUGHT THEY HAVE TO HELP CATCH THE OTHERS.WHEN WE PLAY THREE EYES AT SCHOOL ONE PERSON IS CATCHER AND STANDS AT A POST AND THE GROUP RUNS AND HIDES WHILE HE OR SHE COUNTS. WHEN THEY HAVE STOPPED COUNTING THE PEOPLE HIDING HAVE TO GET TO THE POST AND SAY THREE EYES, BUT IF THEY ARE SEEN THE PERSON WHO IS CATCHER SAYS THREE EYES AND CATCHES THEM.
